comment.text:
One of my favorite tapas places in Atlanta. I always have a great time at Barcelona. I try to make reservations each time I go because the wait can get a little long when you don't, which we still experienced a bit of a wait on Friday when we went to which we decided to sit at the bar. I want to say it took around 40 mins after checking in to be seated but as mentioned we found a spot at the bar and just ate dinner there. 

The ambiance is always so nice. I love the decor so much. It reminds me of Barcelona! :) 

I order almost the same thing each visit and every time it is tasty. Things I recommend: beef empanadas, garlic shrimp, meatballs, Brussels, broccolini, potato brava. All are fabulous! 

For drinks: The sangrias are a must, we always have a pitcher of each version.

If you are looking for an experience and a romantic spot with exceptional lighting and nice wines then this is the place for you. The service was impeccable and our server was nice, even though his shift was ending. 

The menu was a bit complicated to read and understand, I ended up choosing the potatoes with salsa and cheese over top. I thought it would be a little different (salsa and cheese) it was more like a tomato paste and thick mozzarella. It wasn't bad, just wasn't for me. 

My problem was that I came there very hungry and I wasn't able to eat how I wanted, but I had an amazing time there with friends and the great service.

owner_replies.comment: Hello Dante. My Name is Nicholas and I am the General Manager of Ironworks Barcelona. I would like to hear more about what makes the menu confusing and understand how you wanted to eat. I'm curious if you received the menu explanation from our team members to help you understand the layout of our menu. please feel free to reach out to me at ncleveland@barcelonawinebar.com. I would like to make this right for you. Thank you for the review and I look forward to speaking with you.

comment.text:
I've been going to Barcelona for almost 4 years and have never been disappointed by the food. The menu is pretty extensive and changes periodically, which is nice if you frequent -- you can still get the staples you love while also trying new dishes! They can mark up the menu for me to show what's vegan or can be made vegan (sometimes I still have to ask questions, but we get to an answer quickly), and there are plenty of options so I'm not limited to just one or two things.

They have fresh bread baked all throughout the day... to say it's UH-mazing is an understatement. I often fill up on the bread before my food even makes it to the table!!

The service is usually great and on the occasion when it's not, it's still good.

This location only has valet parking after 5pm. There is also a parking garage next door.

The ambiance is perfect for date night. They turn the lights down around 5/6pm and light a candle on each table.

photos.caption: Left to right: spinach chickpea cozuela (vegan as is), red pepper hummus (so good!!), champiñones (vegan as is).

comment.text: Came here for an early Mother's Day outing. Really great environment (sat outside) and vibe. Strongly suggest making a reservation (I overheard the hostess quoting an hour and a half wait). We ordered the Hanger Steak, Pork Belly, Empandas and Calamari with the red Sangria. It was l great and came out extremely quick. We enjoyed it!

Really great place for wine, snacks and conversation! We had a reservation on a Saturday afternoon... we were seated right away. The place was buzzing with people and the servers greeted us right away. Two couples in our party and we ordered wine and beer. First came our Charcuterie with killer good Manchego etc. We then had Bacon wrapped dates sitting on Blue Cheese... mmm SO delicious... definitely be ordering these again!! The Spicy Beef Empanadas were also very good. We shared a slice of Burnt Basque Cheesecake, which was the perfect finish for our little soirée. Onto Hamilton at The Fox. We'll definitely go back to this eclectic restaurant and try some more options of their great cuisine... might try the happy hour next visit.

photos.caption: Bacon wrapped dates... almost gone before I could take pic

comment.text:
Sorry I'm advance for the OK pictures haha. This place was pretty nice on the inside, it was so packed so I couldn't really admire everything. This place is definitely great for dates. 
Unfortunately my friend and I didn't LOVE the food. We started off with a couple of sangrias. I'm more of a sweet wine person and the sangrias were more on the bitter side. We then got our table and started with fried cauliflower and calamari. The fried cauliflower was really good! Definitely had a kick to it. 
The calamari was okay. We didn't think it had much flavor to it, but it was cooked well. The charcuterie board we ordered was okay as well. Didn't pair with anything we had so of anything to eat the cheese and salami with. Last we had steak, it had a  great flavor and was cooked very well. We thought it came with different potatoes, but maybe we were confused.

owner_replies.comment: Hello Dazziyah, Thank you for joining us yesterday. I would love to talk to you more about your experience and your feedback on the food. Im curious if you were told about our sweet white sangrias. They are delicious and I think you would really love them if you like sweet drinks. I am disappointed you left under whelmed. . We pride ourselves on pairing great wines with great food and great cocktails. I would like to make sure you get that experience. I can be reached at ncleveland@barcelonawinebar.com. I look forward to hearing more and talking with you. Thank you for your feedback.

comment.text:
My visit to Barcelona Westside left me somewhat disappointed. The food, to put it frankly, was just okay; nothing particularly outstanding. Unfortunately, the overall vibe of the place didn't sit well with me either. It lacked the charm or atmosphere I was hoping for, which left me with a less-than-ideal experience.

I wish I could say more but I felt grossed out eating there and don't know if I will be back.

owner_replies.comment: Hello Helena. I Would like to hear about your experience last night at Barcelona. I am very sorry you did not enjoy your food or the enviorment. I want to make this right and would like the opportunity to speak with you. If you could reach out to me at Ncleveland@barcelonawinebar.com we can connect. Thank you for the feedback and I want to show you a true Barcelona experience.

comment.text:
We came back for dinner and drinks as it's nearby and the service was amazing. The managers were super nice and made sure our dinner went well! The food and drinks are always amazing here. We always love the starter bread as it goes with all of their tapas! 

For drinks, we ordered from their craft cocktails and every single one was great. I loved the black salt in the flor de sal as it was perfect with the sourness of the drink. The white sangria was also another table favorite. It was perfect for a warm day and with our dinner. 

All the desserts we had were also great. I especially loved the crunchiness of the flan. Can't wait to come here again!

owner_replies.comment: Hello Sydney. Thank you for your feedback from Friday night. If your able to reach out to me I would like to hear more about your experience. Please reach out to me at Ncleveland@barcelonawinebar.com. I am disappointed to hear your experience was not thrilling and we want to make sure we make this right for you. I look forward to talking to you and learning more. Thank you.

comment.text:
If you're looking for delicious charcuterie and tapas Barcelona Westside is THE place. I absolutely love the ability to grab little plates to try and share with friends and everything I've ever had here is delicious. They also offer larger plates that take about 45 minutes to an hour to come back but they're definitely worth the wait. We had the Chicken Pimientos last night and that sauce!!! I need the recipe! 

It can get a little loud inside sometimes but they have outdoor seating as well. The patio is so lovely, especially now that the weather is cooling off! 

I'd also recommend coming here on your birthday because they do a fun little birthday drink for you (reference the video) and they share it with the table! 

Tip: Valet Park! It's only $5 whereas the deck is $15 for 2 hours then an additional $5 for every hour you add on.

I thoroughly enjoyed the restaurant. The ambiance and scenery was delightful, and the service was prompt. Every dish was fantastic, especially the potatoes and pork. If you're in the mood for tapas or small plates, this place is a must-try!

Took mother in law for happy hour! The espresso martini was great and if you like dirty martinis the happy hour menu is fantastic. I wish there was maybe different drinks on there since the martinis seem more of an evening late night cocktails.

We had ham and cheese croquettes and those were delicious as always.
Order the mushrooms and sheeps cheese. Put the mushrooms on top- chefs kiss. Sooooo good together or separate.

The only item we didnt like was the bacon wrapped dates. Whatever cheese they used on the bottom of the plate just overpowered our taste buds. I wouldve gone with something more subtle. You couldnt even taste the date the cheese took over!

Great place with delicious tapas and drinks though!
Valet is fantastic considering parking in this area can get super pricey.

My experience here was great! Made a reservation on a Friday night and they were busy!! The table didn't tKe more than 10 minutes and the manager walked us over. He was very nice and wished me a happy birthday! 

The food was good my favorites: the chorizo, brussel sprouts, drunken goat cheese and the calamari were excellent. 

Our server was great and allowed ample time for us to enjoy without us feeling neglected. Even though it was busy we still felt tended to. 

The restaurant is beautiful! The music was excellent and everyone was so incredibly nice. 

There is a lil birthday celebration they do but I wont spoil it for you! Definitely must go back I've been telling all my friends about it!

photos.caption: The menu with just the cheese & charcuterie
red sangria, white sangria and a merlot

comment.text: My first time at this location and it definitely matches the one on highland. Great service, great food and a nice patio.

The Mrs and I decided to check out this spot for a nightcap and were pleased with our overall experience. 

We walked in on a Friday night and the place was booming. So if you're in a large party or would like a table. I would recommend making a reservation. The wait would have been 30/45 mins for a table for two so we decided to sit at the bar. 

For food we ordered the bacon wrapped dates, grilled chicken, fried cauliflower, and the crispy calamari. For drinks we got a Alebrijes cocktail and a Nectar sherry. 

Overall both the drinks and food was good and a decide portion size for tapas style dishes. Taking off one star because I thought the chicken could have been grilled a bit more and the sherry was super sweet! But I just charged that to those two things not really being for me, but someone else may like them. 

If you're looking for a nap cap after a date night or a spot to connect with a small group of friends before you get into something else, I would definitely recommend here. 

Oh! And if you drive valet park. It's only $5 and definitely worth it.

Barcelona is the perfect modern take on Spanish tapas. They have many locations across the United States and the atmosphere maintains the same fun and energetic ambience and service. No matter where you are, if you walk into a Barcelona, it's bound to be busy.

Great place to come with a party of four of more. There's something for everyone on their tapas menu. 

While you can't go wrong with any of their food, my top two menu picks are their white sangria and their gambas ajillo.

photos.caption: gambas al ajillo and patatas bravas

comment.text:
We like barcelona very much. It is always fun
We Enjoy the food, the drinks, the atmosphere
The vibe was amazing! The drinks were great and the foods was perfect. The service was on point. This is one of my favorite places to go in Atlanta. It's a great date spot.

My go-to spot. Great for date night, girls night out, large group gatherings. The only thing is it can be tough doing tapas with big groups with different tastes, allergies, etc, but it's definitely doable - and fun! Just love the vibes here - I've closed it out a few too many times. 

*FOOD*  I always start with a charcuterie board. I like the jammón serrano (an aged thinly sliced ham - has a smokey taste to it that I love), soria chorizo (spicy chorizo sausage), drunken goat (goat cheese soaked in red wine - a MUST), and the manchego (your hard cheese, and I mean it's manchego, need I say more?). 

For tapas, they're always changing the offerings but these are some of my trusty go-tos that will please the table. The patatas bravas are a must - and they're a guaranteed favorite for all of the table. The whipped sheep's cheese is delicious and comes with hard toasted bread. The croquetas are a must for cheese fans - they are basically a delicious ball of cheese with little bits of ham in it - hot and gooey in a crusted shell. If your table likes seafood, I recommend the grilled pulpo and mussels. 

Regardless, you can't go wrong here. Oh, and don't forget an espresso martini for dessert here. These espresso martinis are coffee-forward - and not solely coffee cream liqueur like other spots do it - so they're good stuff. 

*PARKING*  They have valet only right out front for a couple of bucks. 

This place will be a guaranteed favorite once you try it. Cheers!

Everything here is fantastic!  We were there with a large group, so we were able to sample many of the menu items and I loved everything!  The restaurant is busy and noisy, but it just adds to the party-like feel of the place!  Be sure to make reservations . . . this place is popular.

Our servers were excellent . . . funny, attentive, helpful, and so professional.  My favorite dishes of the evening were the incredible paella, the jamon and manchego croquetas, the grilled broccolini, and the patatas bravas.   Everything was wonderful so it was hard to pick my favorites.  We plan to become regulars here . . . the food is just that good!

The interior overwhelmingly loud, and can't be recommended for anyone hard of hearing. Likewise, in the evenings, the lighting is dim to the point of having to hold up the menu to the light coming in from the windows to read it. 

I have likewise luke-warm feelings about the food, which I found to be very hit or miss:

Burrata 2/5 - The very mild flavor of the cheese was drowned out by the rest of the plate. 

Lamb Chops 5/5 - Well-seasoned and tasty, if a tad salty.

Mussels 5/5 - Some of the best I've had anywhere. 

Watermelon Salad - 4/5 Tasty, but a rather small portion for the price and ingredients.

Scallops - 4/5 Scallops themselves were perfectly prepared, toasty on the outside and soft and delicious on the inside, but the sauce was a poor choice of accompaniment. 

Overall, I can recommend it, but only just.

This is a wonderful venue with a nice ambiance, stellar service, and an excellent menu featuring many popular dishes from its namesake. The wine list is also on point and made more desirable by the inclusion of one of my favorites varietals, Tempranillo.

Barcelona has a lavish indoor space along with an expansive bar with indoor/outdoor seating and a wide variety of artisan cocktails. I'm old so it's easier for me to find room a little earlier in the evening, but this is a hot spot and gets packed during prime time and on weekend evenings. If you enjoy food in a nice place, Barcelona should definitely be on your list. Valet parking is available, or you can park in the Interlock garage.

Always remember to ask for bread. All their dishes are good and every season affect the menu. Calamari is a good sharing dish and crispy. Mussels was fragrant and flavorful. Fig & sausage is sweet and savory. Their brunch are also delicious. I miss their shrimp & grits.

What a wonder establishment! I can not recommend Barcelona Westside Ironworks enough. We just hosted a fantastic "after wedding party" there Saturday night from 11pm - 1am. The ambiance was amazing... giant fire in the outdoor fireplace the umbrellas situated perfectly so even though there was a lite drizzle we could still be outside to enjoy it! The staff went above and beyond even supplying little signs on the bar celebrating the newly married couple. The entire staff was terrific! We had over 100 in our party and they took our orders in stride offering their full menu of drinks. The bartenders were so good! Their specialty gin and tonics were a hit! 
I worked with Julie Clark prior to this event and she took care of making sure our night went off without a hitch. We had a delicious meat and cheese board, fresh bread, Spanish olives and almonds that were constantly being replenished.  If you are looking to host an event in Atlanta please give Julie a call because Barcelona Ironworks should be on the top of your list! .

5 stars for food
2 for service 

Ordered 5 appetizers and 2 drinks. Food came out almost instantly. All 5 at the same time. Drinks took 10-15 minutes while the food cooled down. 

Had to constantly ask for dirty plates and glasses to be removed from table as we finished and ate more and drank more. 

When dessert came we had to ask server to clear our table first   See the picture. 

Owner needs to talk with manager.

photos.caption: Server brought our 2 desserts but We had to ask for table to cleared first??

owner_replies.comment: Good afternoon- I am very sorry to hear about the poor service you received on your most recent visit and would like chance to personally apologize and see what I can do to make it right.  Please let me know the best way to contact you @ kperlman@barcelonawinebar.com  We value your business and appreciate your feedback.  Thank you Kenny

comment.text: I love Barcelona! Such a great tapas place with good sangria. The vibe is cool too. It is open late too which is a plus. I will continue coming back!

This was my first time at this location. I've been to the other location in Inman Park in addition to a location in Hartford connecticut. The menu and Vibe are all very similar. I would recommend getting three small plates per person for a full meal. I went with my parents in the afternoon. They were just switching from brunch menu. We got the octopus and the prawns. The octopus came with garbanzo beans and had a nice Char on the outside and was succulent in the middle. The prawns were really plain. It seemed like they were just boiled with some kind of chimichurri/ bacious oil. Can't recommend that one. The server was really nice and was able to make some recommendations. Good thing here is that valet parking is complimentary you just need to give them a tip

Barcelona is the best place to come for happy hour. I especially love the vibe on the patio. The last time I went the computer system was down so I just got a sangria and no food, but the food is usually great--I especially recommend the short rib if it's on the menu when you visit.

photos.caption: Seasonal white sangria--peach flavor. A little sweet, but not overwhelmingly so.

comment.text: I've been to the other Barcelona location at Highland, so am a bit biased in this review. That said, this location is just as good as the other (if not slightly better). We went during happy hour, sat in the very nice patio area, and got drinks as well as a plethora of tapas. The highlight was the Gambas (shrimp) as well as the bone marrow. The only dish that was a little lackluster was the happy hour steak tartar. It was just too many different flavors competing. What elevated the food and drink experience beyond expectations was the service. Eric, who I assume is part of management, went above and beyond to chat with us and make sure we were taken care of. This location is in great hands.
The service is great, but the food is just ok. The restaurant offers valet parking. We ordered the meatballs, cauliflower, steak, papas bravas, and an espresso martini.

owner_replies.comment: Hello Lauren. I’m disappointed that your experience with our food did not leave you thrilled. I would like the opportunity to talk with you more about your experience. Please reach out to me at ncleveland@barcelonawinebar.com and we can connect. Thank you for your feedback and I look forward connecting.

comment.text:
I've been to the other location of Barcelona frequently, but this was my first time at this location. I enjoy this location because its just a few feet away from the Bellyard Hotel which has PuttShack, Velvet Taco and other eateries. Plus there's plenty of parking options. You can park/valet in the lot near the restaurant or park at the in the deck next door at the Interlock for hourly parking. There's also parking across the street in the garage near Little Trouble.

The service was good. Our server was extremely attentive and was great at suggesting recommendations for drinks. We ordered some tapas. The broccolini, jamon y manchego croquettes, spinach and chickpea cazuela. All were really delicious especially the spinach and chickpea cazuela. I am not a huge chickpea fan, but it was one of my favorites of the night.

I also order the large meat plate with steak, chicken, pork and sausage. Overall, the meat was under seasoned. The chicken was the most flavorful.  We got the half order and there was enough for two people. 

At this point, I feel like I've had just about all their tapas, but I can always try more on the menu. The sangria is always my go to and it never disappoints. I will definitely be back to this location.

This place never disappoints! The menu is innovative and tasty and drinks are creative. Perfect place to impress or chill on the patio and reflect on all the new construction in midtown. 
Patio seating is tight, if you don't want to over hear your neighbor, try to interior for seating. The bar is a great option if your solo and want to interact.

All the tapas - chorizo with figs, eggplant, meatballs, spicy beef empanadas and ham and cheese croquettes were so good.  We were pretty full after enjoying these, but since large plates take 45-69 mins, we ordered the whole Branzino and paella up front.  By the time they arrived, we were pretty stuffed.  So glad we ordered the Branzino -  so good.

As with both Atlanta locations, you really can't go wrong with the food, service and ambiance. If you are into Tapas style eating, this is perfect and great for large groups. Always lots of fun and the staff does a very good job.

It was alright, pretty much on par with the other tapas places I've been to. Music was ridiculously loud and didn't match the vibes at all -- could barely hear my friends. Ashley was a sweet and efficient server. The food came out pretty quickly. Overall the food was okay, I liked the potatoes the most but none of it was much to write home about. The restaurant also felt very crowded. But it's cute it's trendy and it's efficient for sure. Maybe a good happy hour spot?

owner_replies.comment: Jessie Thank you so much for dining with us.  I am very sorry that the music was overwhelming.  We value your business and appreciate your feedback.   I would love to make sure that your Next visit is better.  Please reach out so that I can make a reservation for you and ensure everything is up to our standards.  kperlman@barcelonawinebar.com

comment.text: The good was great and the service was unmatched. I couldn't decide what I wanted to drinks d our waiter was super patient and graciously provided some samples of the ones I though I wanted ultimately picking a really great wine to complement the dishes I ordered. This location has a certain vibe to it that I really enjoyed will definitely be back

We came during happy hour for a quick midday get together. Orlando made our first  drinks which were fabulous, where elliot came on the back end and made us his own version of shots and second round of drinks. Both gentlemen paid close attention and conversation throughout our stay. Definitely recommend.

I LOVE this place, I have been obsessed with tapas the past couple of years and this spot here did NOT disappoint at all! 

I have tried almost everything on the menu and nothing has been bad. They have valet parking, there is parking surrounding the bar, I am not 100% sure if you can park here without valeting. 

The customer service has always been excellent as well, I haven't had a bad experience.

I was here recently for a work dinner. We ordered a bunch of things, and all of them were very tasty, with my favorite dishes being the patatas bravas and jamón and manchego croquetas. The restaurant is fairly large, with indoor and outdoor space, and was able to seat our big party pretty quickly. Service was also good. I would definitely come back here again!

Great for drinks and a light meal! Service is friendly and knowledgeable. Decent wine by the glass list. Lots of different tapas to try! Note they have a happy hour that they don't seem to advertise, but ask about it!

Just an amazing spot to hang and get to some Tapas and cocktails. 

We sat at the bar and ordered many plates, all were so delicious and don't forget the Sangria which is awesome. 

Awesome spot to chill enjoy the food and just relax.

We came in on a Sunday and were told the wait would be over an hour... (come prepared to wait)

We opted to sit at the bar and enjoy the good food, music, and ambiance. We had a great bar tender and server, shout out to Jake!

The food took us on a journey that led to happy and full tummies! We will definitely return.
We LOVE Barcelona. Every trip to ATL calls for a visit. The food is always amazing, the service is always kind and welcoming, and the vibes are immaculate!
It's a nice tapas bar. Great for a light meal. The olive oil cake is pretty good. The potatoes are my favorite !

My significant other made reservations for our anniversary and it was simply amazing! The ambience is superb, the service is top tier, and the food was great! We did the two options of the wine flights and enjoyed tasting each wine. They serve tapas so the portions are not entree size, FYI! The waitress recommended all of our tapa options and they were all amazing! Great play for a date night or even a night out with friends and/family! You won't be disappointed!

Came here for brunch and really enjoyed the food! Give your car to valet for sure because the deck ended up being more expensive for me. 

We had a reservation so it didn't take long to get seated. It's a tapas place so we ordered a bunch for the table. I would say my faves were the fried chicken, the empanadas and the patatas bravas. The portions r quite small if you're splitting with many people so order two of each if you're a group of 6 or more. 

The service was a bit slow at some points and they had run out bread? But then we saw more bread on other tables. Food however was definitely 5 star quality.

They were so busy, even with a reservation, we could only side outside in July- a little hot!  But the food and drinks were so worth it!  We attend Atlanta Market twice a year and believe me this will be on our favorites rotation. We really couldn't decide on a favorite: the cheese boards, the potato tortilla, (order this early) paella salvaje, whipped sheep's cheese, and watermelon salad.

Great spot for drinks and casual catch up! This place is kind of upscale and very intimate and date night. Almost everyone here was apart of a date and I came with 2 girlfriends so it was kinda like oooh okay. LOL

The wine selection was great! I'd recommend

I came here with a party of 10 on a Sunday around 2 PM. There is parking available on site as well as valet. The restaurant has seating both inside and outside, with outdoor heaters for those cool nights.

We sat inside at a long table near the bar. Our waitress was kind and informative. We ordered two pitchers of the white sangria, each being $30, and proceeded to try a bit of everything. favorites at the table were: olive oil pancakes, the potatoes, and the honey chicken. 

There were some slight mishaps with our orders but the waitress and manager were so accommodating that we didn't mind at all. I am eager to return!

photos.caption: Olive Oil Pancakes // Croquettes // White Sangria

comment.text: I made a reservation for 8:45 on a saturday night. Upon checking in, the hostess let me know there would be a 20-30 min delay because they were trying to seat everyone inside due to the rain. However, after checking in 3 times with the hostess and 2 hours AFTER our reservation time, we were seated. Every time I would ask the hostess, they would say 10 minutes or 15 minutes. People who checked in after were seated first and there were multiple empty tables. I understand shortness of staff but the table we were sat at was clean and ready 30-40 min before they sat us down. The food and drinks are good but expensive but although the staff is nice, the poor service will prevent me from going back here.

owner_replies.comment: Hello Navya, My name is Nicholas and I am the General Manager of Barcelona Ironworks. I can be reached at ncleveland@barcelonawinebar.com. I am disappointed that you had to wait for 2 hours to get your table. I understand the frustration you must have felt. I would like to speak with you to hear more about your experience. I want to make this right for you. I look forward to hearing from you. I would love the opportunity to have you back to have you leave us thrilled.

comment.text: I love coming here for late-night bites since their tapas are the perfect size to snack and drink at the same time! The bartenders are very knowledgeable about their wine, which I appreciate. They're also super chatty and friendly! It's always popping when I come here, I love the late-night vibes. There's lots of bar seating available. Their octopus is really delicious! I think next time I come I'll definitely need to try one of their charcuterie boards
